gov.usgs.anss.edgemom

Class MulticastQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgemom.MulticastQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class MulticastQueue
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class is a generalized Client which queues and dequeues messages as byte arrays normally for the MulticastListeners (queue) and the MulticastProcessor(dequeue). The MultiCastProcessor creates one of these and gives this object to all actually listeners. If the queue overflows the data are discarded. Status includes number of discarded packets, packets processed, queue highwater.

    In addition to the binary bytes the length of each packet and the internet socket of queuer is tracked for use by the processing routine. 

     switch     args     Description
 -qsize    nn        Number of buffers of qlen to reserve for the queue
 -qlen     nn        The length of the buffering in the queue(def=512)
 -dbg                Create more output

      • dequeue

        public int dequeue(byte[] buf)
        Dequeue one buffer if it is available, the length of the buffer is returned and the socket the data came from is available by calling getSockAddress immediately after this returns something.
        Parameters:
        buf - User buffer to return the input packet
        Returns:
        Number of bytes returned or zero if nothing was returned, or -1 if there is nothing to return

      • queue

        public boolean queue(java.net.DatagramPacket d,
                     int port)
        Queue up the contents of one DatagramPacket - save the data play load as a byte array, the length and the sender of the packet
        Parameters:
        d - The datagram packet to queue.
        port - the port the packet was received on
        Returns:
        true, if the packet was queue, false if there was no room.
